strings: <voice_0x01000C79><se_high>Emma: Did you meet with His Majesty in the royal suite!?
<voice_0x01000C7A><se_high>Emma: I must explain! The King is refusing to speak with anyone at present. Please forgive him if he caused offence.
<voice_0x01000C7B><se_high>Emma: You see, he's never been quite the same since Queen Sasha died two years ago.

<voice_0x01000C7C><se_high>Emma: If only it were possible to meet with those who've passed away... It would mean the
world to the King if he could see his Queen
once more.

<voice_0x01000C7D><se_high>Emma: ...You know, my grandmother used to tell
me lots of stories when I was small.
Lots of very strange stories.

<voice_0x01000C7E><se_high>Emma: I'm sure there was one about a way to make
any wish come true... It's no good, though.
I just can't remember it.

<voice_0x01000C7F><se_high>Emma: I'm sure she'd be happy to tell me if I went to
see her, but I'm so busy with work here at
the castle...
<voice_0x01000C80><se_high>Emma: I'm afraid I must ask you a favour.
<voice_0x01000C81><se_high>Emma: I'd like you to go and see my grandmother. She lives in a house west of here, next to a bridge.
<voice_0x01000C82><se_high>Emma: Could you ask her to tell you the old story about how to make wishes come true?
<voice_0x01000C83><se_high>Emma: Maybe it's just a fairy tale, but if there's any chance it might be true, then I have to try and help the King.

<voice_0x01000C84><se_high>Emma: I wish I could go and ask her myself,
but there's so much to do here at the castle.
And I... I can't leave him on his own...

<voice_0x01000C85><se_high>Emma: I'm really counting on your help.
My grandmother lives west of Ascantha,
in a house next to a bridge.
<voice_0x01000C86><se_high>Emma: I pray at church every day that the King will be happy again. Please...help me to help him...
